byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel and French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy achieve last-minute deal with European banking establishment to save the euro by telling them to accept 50 percent write-down or bear the consequences of default; complex deal forces banks to pay a greater share of Greece's effective default.
snippet: In the end, it was Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and President Nicolas Sarkozy of France against the European banking establishment — and the bankers blinked.
lead_paragraph: In the end, it was Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and President Nicolas Sarkozy of France against the European banking establishment — and the bankers blinked.

headline.main: Calling Bankers’ Bluff, Merkel Won Europe a Debt Plan
headline.print_headline: Merkel Called Bankers’ Bluff, Getting Europe a Financial Plan
